subject: Re: junit 4+ and ant task
msgSnippet: JUnit 4.x and Ant 1.7 work together, without the need of any adapter. I had the symptoms you describe when I used JUnit 4.x with Ant 1.6.x. Regards, Jan ...
messageBody:
JUnit 4.x and Ant 1.7 work together, without the need of any adapter.
I had the symptoms you describe when I used JUnit 4.x with Ant 1.6.x.

Regards, Jan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Andrew McDonagh" <andrewmcdonagh@...>
wrote:
>
> GOOGLE junit4testadapter
>
> On 5/26/07, Andrew McDonagh <andrewmcdonagh@...> wrote:
> > Hi there is an extra addition to you test classes needed. google
ant
> > junit testsuite
> >
> >
> > On 5/25/07, rjminsha <rjminsha@...> wrote:
> > > Hi.
> > >
> > > Usually I invoke junit 4.1 tests in ant by invoking java
directly.
> > > However, I would like to leverage the xml and html formats that
> > > available if I use the junit ant task.
> > >
> > > The junit ant task says that it works with 4.0 style junit
tests but
> > > when I inovke it I get a message indicating that there are not
test
> > > cases in my class.
> > >
> > > When I switch the style of my tests to junit 3.8 things work
fine.
> > >
> > > Does the ant task support junit 4.x ? If so what version of
ant ( did
> > > not seem to in 1.7 ) ?
> > >
> > > If not, what is the best approach here to use junit 4.x and
generate
> > > xml and html output that is consistent with my 3.8 log
analyzers ?
> > >
> > > thanks,
> > > Robbie
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
